title: Emails received by the mail server are not displayed in Thunderbird
content:
Hello everyone,

I'm experiencing the following issue and am having trouble resolving it.

・Normally, automatic reply emails should be received when there are inquiries from the website, but they are not displayed in Thunderbird. ・When I check the webmail on the mail server, I can see the emails, so they are definitely being delivered to the server. ・Occasionally, there have been delivery failures in the past, but since March 19th, not a single email has been received. ・As shown in the attached image, when I open Thunderbird, it displays "Downloading messages," and even when it reaches 60/60 downloads completed, the 60 emails are not displayed.

I suspect that the spam filter might be reacting, but I'm unsure of what to do. Could you please advise me?
creator: shuta.hanura

title: Yandex calendar events are not visible in the calendar Thuderbird
content:
I have Yandex Calendar enabled on a Windows computer using CalDAV in two applications - Thunderbird and OneCalendar. On an android phone, Yandex Calendar is enabled in the Yandex Calendar app.

Android App <--> [Yandex] <--> Thunderbird Calendar (Windows) 

                                            <--> OneCalendar (Windows)

When I create an event in the Yandex Calendar app for Android, they are visible in the calendar web interface, they are visible in OneCalendar on a Windows computer, but not visible in the Thunderbird calendar on a Windows computer. All other events created in the apps and web interface are visible in the Thunderbird calendar. All CalDAV connection settings in Thunderbird and OneCalendar are the same

I would be very grateful for any advice to solve this problem.
creator: vitaly.mail

title: Transferring email to another account
content: I have configured two email accounts, both GMail. I often need to transfer email from one account to another within the client. When the message I move contains attachments weighing more than 5MB, Thunderbird crashes and the transfer does not take place. The only solution found, which I would like to avoid, is to download the message with a save as, then drag the .eml file to the right folder on the different account. I also tried setting the parameter mailnews.tcptimeout from 100 (default) to 1000. Nothing has changed. Is there a procedure or program setting that allows seamless transfer of messages from one account to another even when it contains attachments? Thank you
creator: l.amodei

title: Why can't I see any posts at all in Usenet for the newsgroup I use?
content:
I occasionally have problems with Thunderbird insisting that posts in my frequently visited newsgroup are expired when they are not. Previouly, I've been able to resolve this problem by simply unsubscribing from the newsgroup and then subscribing again. But today, when I tried that technique, Thunderbird told me that there were no messages at all in my newsgroup. This is flat-out wrong because the newsgroup is quite active. Right-clicking and choosing Get Messages did NOT change the situation.

Then, to add an extra layer of aggravation, I added a second newsgroup to my subscriptions, one for Thunderbird itself, but it was empty. I deleted that folder and then unsubscribed to my other newsgroup and tried to subscribe again but now the "Manage subscriptions" button shows me no newsgroups whatsoever!

I am beyond frustrated by this nonsense. What do I need to do to get "Manage subscriptions" to show me the thousands of newsgroups that exist and how do I make "Get messages" to show me the messages currently on my newsgroup?

I'm using Eternal September to access Usenet. My operating system is Windows 10. The version of Thunderbird I'm using is 128.8.1esr (32-bit).
creator: frank-lee-speeking

title: Thunderbird non invia mail
content: Ciao a tutti dall'ultimo aggiornamento di Thunderbird del 18/03/2025 e dall'ultimo aggiornamento di Windows del 12/03/2025, c'è un problema con il server in uscita SMTP e non posso inviare le mail. (vedi screen shot allegato) Riporto i dati: - versione Thunderbird 128.8.1 esr - S.O. Windows Home versione 24H2 - Provider mail Gmail - Account POP 3 - Nessuna estensione o componenti aggiuntivi - Antivirus Norton 360 Preciso che ho provato a disattivare l'antivirus, il firewall, la VPN e il proxi, inoltre la modalità "Risoluzione problemi" non ha dato alcuna segnalazione. Anche con questi interventi il problema rimane. Ho verificato le impostazioni dell'account e sono corrette. Grazie in anticipo a chiunque potrà aiutarmi. Giuseppe
creator: gp.caricati

title: Email Account Settings for mail.twc.com through Spectrum
content:
Relating to Thunderbird. Two email accounts, Gmail and Spectrum's "mail.twc.com", required setting up with Thunderbird. Gmail was no problem with immediate success. "mail.twc.com" was another matter. This particular account is setup and working on 3 Apple devices under IOS yet Thunderbird will not allow 'sign in' during 'texardvark@twc.com' - using SAME settings. Web searches reveal settings that should work however they don't correspond to options provided during Thunderbird setup. In particular, there is a log-in failure using same login credentials as IOS.

This problem is not earthshaking as I can use TWC Webmail w/o any problems, just not through Thunderbird. I'm primarily providing this information toward your development efforts. I used Thunderbird with Linux and was pleased. Thought I'd give it a try on PC Windows 11.
creator: texardvark
